data.text: @WAGovernment I have tried calling +61891183100 but it does not allow you to progress to an advisor and the recorded information is not up to date ie. Does not reflect changes made on 3 March.

@WAGovernment When checking State requirements it states “Proof of vaccination requirements apply to all travellers to WA who are eligible to be vaccinated.”  Is a 12 year Uk resident classed as ‘eligible’ as they are unable to be vaccinated in the UK? I need to speak to someone.

@WAGovernment Thank you again but referring me to the same website/link is not helpful.  On that website, it states: Travellers to Aust need to comply with requirements in the State of their arrival …
@LeanneP76237443 Hi Leanne, You will need to refer to the web link, we only provide advice on entering the State. The Commonwealth Government is responsible for the international border conditions

@WAGovernment Thank you for your response but there is no mention of 12 year old children who are not vaccinated (due to their age in the UK) and the fact they have had Covid recently so must wait 12 weeks.  Is there a phone number so I can contact someone to discuss? Thanks.
@LeanneP76237443 Hi Leeanne, The Commonwealth Government is responsible for the international border entry conditions. Please visit their site https://t.co/tLjLeovRLN

@WAGovernment Your website does not provide information about children.  I have a 12 year old who cannot be vaccinated in the UK as he had Covid in Jan (can legally have 1st vax on 19 Apr) & we hope to visit family in WA on 25 Mar. Is he considered unvaxed and will he need to quarantine? Help
@RTIOUKB @WDG2022 @WAGovernment And we can trust you? Some person behind a tweet? Fuck off
